page.description: The EMAIL_SMTP_SEND() function sends a message through a SMTP mail server. This function, along with EMAIL_SMTP_OPEN()and EMAIL_SMTP_CLOSE(), will allow you to send email from a computer that does not have an Alpha Anywhere email profile.
page.syntax: Result_Flag as L = email_smtp_send(P pMessage ,P pSocket [,L lStatus [,L autowrap ]])

argument.name: Result_Flag
argument.description: Pointer. .T. = The message was sent successfully. .F. = The message was not sent.

argument.name: pMessage
argument.description: A pointer variable containing the message.

item.name: .TO
item.description: The recipient list. Multiple entries are separated by commas. Microsoft Outlook allows you to format the address as "recipient_name". This hides the "" portion of the field from the recipient.

item.name: .CC
item.description: The CC list. Multiple entries are separated by commas.

item.name: .CHARSET
item.description: Specifies the character set you want to use, ex. UTF8.

item.name: .BCC
item.description: The BCC list. Multiple entries are separated by commas.

item.name: .SUBJECT
item.description: The subject line of the email.

item.name: .MESSAGE
item.description: The body of a text message.

item.name: .HTML_MESSAGE
item.description: The body of a HTML message.

item.name: .ATTACHMENTS
item.description: A semi-colon (;), comma, or CR-LF delimited list of filenames.

item.name: .XMAILER
item.description: Optional. Default = NULL. The sending email program.

item.name: .LRELATED
item.description: Optional. Default = .F. .T. = Attachments are embedded image in the HTML message. .F. = Attachments are separate files.

item.name: .RETURNRECEIPT
item.description: Optional. Default = .F. (Requires V8, addin build 3090 or later). If .t. then an e-mail will be sent to the sender acknowledging that the recipient has read the e-mail. Note that not all e-mail clients support this feature and the recipient might decline to send the receipt.

argument.name: pSocket
argument.description: A pointer variable that is populated by EMAIL_SMTP_OPEN().

argument.name: lStatus
argument.description: LogicalOptional. Default = .F. Whether to show a progreess meter or not. .T. = Show a progress meter. .F. = Do not show a progress meter.

argument.name: autowrap
argument.description: Logical. Optional. Default = .T. Whether to force text emails to wrap at 72 characters per line. .T. = Automatically wrap all lines of text at 72 characters or less. .F. = Leave text email body unchanged.

section.title: Example
section.example:
DIM ps as P DIM pm as P
pm.from = "aaron@alphasoftware.com" pm.from_alias = "Aaron Brown" pm.to = "ed@alphasoftware.com" pm.cc = "selwyn@alphasoftware.com" pm.bcc = "richard@alphasoftware.com pm.subject = "This is a test" pm.message = "This is the body of the message" pm.html_message = "HTML Body goes here
pm.attachments = <<%str% C:\dev\test.zip C:\my documents\report.zip %str%
'optional header fields pm.xmailer = "Alpha Mailer" pm.lRelated = .F.
' send message IF email_smtp_open(ps, "mail.alphasoftware.com")
email_smtp_send(pm, ps) END IF Email_smtp_close(ps)

section.title: Character Sets
section.description: You can specify the character set when using the email_smtp_send() function.
section.example: DIM ps as P DIM pm as P pm.from = "aaron@alphasoftware.com" pm.from_alias = "Aaron Brown" pm.to = "ed@alphasoftware.com" pm.subject = "This is a test" ' Text that contains non ascii characters - encoded as UTF8 pm.message = convert_acp_to_utf8("même manière") ' Indicate that we want to send the text with 'utf8' encoding pm.charset = "utf8" IF email_smtp_open(ps, "mail.alphasoftware.com") email_smtp_send(pm, ps) END IF Email_smtp_close(ps)
